alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Johnson; Lafayette (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lafayette, southeastern Jackson and northwestern Johnson Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lone Jack, or 8 miles east of Lake Lotawana, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Oak Grove, Odessa, Higginsville, Lone Jack, Lake Lafayette, Bates City, Aullville, Fayetteville, Tarsney Lakes and Pittsville. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 36 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
